sub_topic: Identifying the type of inorganic compound (ionic, covalent, metallic)
message_1: Identify the type of inorganic compound formed between Nitrogen and Oxygen in nitrous oxide (N2O)? Is it ionic, covalent or metallic?
message_2: The inorganic compound formed between Nitrogen and Oxygen in nitrous oxide (N2O) is covalent. Nitrogen and Oxygen are both non-metals, and they share electrons to form a covalent bond.
